definition: not knowing anything at all (idiom); completely ignorant/without an inkling
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
to know/to be aware

sentences.english: Hurstwood knew nothing of the change of temper.
sentences.chinese: 赫斯渥对形势的这些变化一无所知。

sentences.english: To think, I could have lived all my life and missed it.
sentences.chinese: 想想看，我可能会活了一辈子而对此一无所知。

sentences.english: It is because you know nothing about it that I'll tell you from the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 因为你对此事一无所知，所以我将对你从头说起。

sentences.english: He doesn't know even the ABCs of philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 他连哲学的基础知识都一无所知。

sentences.english: The justiciars know nothing of Ireland.
sentences.chinese: 最高法官对爱尔兰情况一无所知。

sentences.english: "He didn't know anything about, " Cannavaro explained.
sentences.chinese: “对此他一无所知，”卡纳瓦罗解释到。

sentences.english: She offers up silly advice and is clueless about the latest fashion rage.
sentences.chinese: 她一无所知，老出馊主意，对流行时尚一窍不通。

sentences.english: An application is blissfully unaware of all this activity.
sentences.chinese: 应用程序很高兴对所有这些活动一无所知。

sentences.english: She had known nothing of the plan. Diego had never let on.
sentences.chinese: 她对这个计划一无所知，迭戈从未吐露只言片语。

sentences.english: We know little about his life.
sentences.chinese: 我们对他的生世几乎一无所知。

sentences.english: I see lots of names of people who have won that I’ve never heard of.
sentences.chinese: 我倒是对不少得过奖的人的名字一无所知。

sentences.english: He knew nothing about the setup of the bowling alley.
sentences.chinese: 他对设置一条保龄球道一无所知。

sentences.english: We know nothing except that the victim is an old man.
sentences.chinese: 除了被害者是个老人外，我们对其他一无所知。

sentences.english: And on the second day after he had killed Godolias, no man yet knowing it.
sentences.chinese: 革达里雅被害后第二天，人尚一无所知。

sentences.english: Now, the old basket maker knew nothing of all this.
sentences.chinese: 老制篮商对这一切一无所知。

sentences.english: But that betrays an ignorance of the creative process.
sentences.chinese: 然而，这倒暴露出对创造过程一无所知。

definition: lit. to know one and understand half (idiom); a smattering of knowledge/dilettante/amateur
to know sth like the back of one's hand (idiom)/to know (a person, a place etc) inside out
variant of 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
lit. doesn't (even) enter a single aperture (of one's head)/I don't understand a word (idiom)/it's all Greek to me
see 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
see 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
to believe firmly without any doubt (idiom)/absolute certainty about sth
to be confused/to be baffled
slight knowledge of sth/to know very little about a subject/a smattering
unclear/not understood/currently unknown
not to mention (idiom); to say not one word/fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
unable to figure out
to know/to understand
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
to refuse to say anything about (idiom)/to remain tight-lipped/to avoid mentioning
to snort disdainfully/to scoff at/to turn up one's nose
to be well aware
